selected_metadata.overview: 一見普通の人間が、角度によって表情を変える能面のような顔に変化していく。地下鉄や夜のコンビニなど、日常的なシチュエーションで発生する異変を描く。
selected_metadata.horror_point: 海外で人気の高い『Uncanny Valley（不気味な谷）』を直撃する。日本の伝統的な不気味さと、現代のLiminal Space的な無機質さが融合し、視聴維持率を跳ね上げる。

data.description: Have you ever noticed someone whose face looks a little too smooth? In the dead of night on a Tokyo subway, you might encounter the Living Noh Mask. This is not a costume or a prank. It is a modern urban legend where a human face transforms based on the angle of light, shifting from joy to deep sorrow in a heartbeat. The Uncanny Valley is real, and it is sitting right across from you. Do you think this is just a story or have you seen a face like this before? Tell us your scariest commute stories in the comments below. Explore the dark side of Japanese urban legends and supernatural encounters in this spine-chilling J-Horror short.

data.editorial_notes: Viral Architectは、視聴者が「自分も遭遇するかもしれない」という恐怖を煽る『NEVER Stare at Strangers in Japan #Shorts』を選定。The Whispererは、能面の「照らす（喜）」「曇る（悲）」の性質を、地下鉄の揺れによる角度変化に落とし込み、現代的な恐怖へ変換。The Visionaryは、Midjourney 6.0を想定し、日本の地下鉄の無機質な照明と、能面の不気味な質感を対比させるライティングを指定。Vrewの読み上げをスムーズにするため、全ての句読点を排除し、リズム感を重視した。映像全体を通して『不気味な谷』の極限を追求している。
data.vrew_script:
Late night on the empty Tokyo subway
Just another tired salaryman sitting across from you
But something about his face is deeply wrong
His skin looks like polished white wood
A frozen expression from an ancient stage play
He does not blink or breathe for a long time
When the train sways his face slowly shifts
A joyful smile turns into a look of deep sorrow
This is not a mask he is wearing
It is his real skin growing cold and hard
The uncanny valley is breathing right next to you
Whatever you do never look him in the eyes

不気味の谷はあなたの隣で息をしている
何をするにしても、彼の目を見てはいけない
